##
tienelle@mendeddrum.org at 2024-07-17T08:51:17.000Z ##

So, Exim has a vulnerability (CVE-2024-39929) which lets a slightly malformed e-mail bypass the "We don't accept .exe or .zip files here" filter. That's definitely a security problem! But.

Why is it assigned a score of 9.1, "Critical"? I'd expect something with that kind of score to involve something like RCE or misdirecting mail, not bypassing a fairly simple-minded filter that will only ever be one layer of your security.

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-07-16T09:40:02.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-39929, the vulnerability can allow threat actors to bypass Exim security filters and deliver malicious emails to users' inboxes.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-39929

##

CVE-2024-6605(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T15:31:03

2 posts

Firefox Android allowed immediate interaction with permission prompts. This could be used for tapjacking. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.844Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.000Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T06:30:38

2 posts

Elements of PDCE does not perform necessary authorization checks for an authenticated user, resulting in escalation of privileges. This allows an attacker to read sensitive information causing high impact on the confidentiality of the application.

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-08T18:25:00.000Z ##

RCE bug in widely used Ghostscript library now exploited in attacks

Tracked as CVE-2024-29510.

RCE in Ghostscript document conversion toolkit, often comes pre-installed on popular #linux distributions. Used by software like LibreOffice, GIMP, and Inkscape.

This vulnerability was patched in May, but a PoC exploit was released by Codean Labs.

This highlights the importance of installing #security patches quickly.

#cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/rce-bug-in-widely-used-ghostscript-library-now-exploited-in-attacks/

CVE-2024-39930
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-05T12:55:51.367000

1 posts

The built-in SSH server of Gogs through 0.13.0 allows argument injection in internal/ssh/ssh.go, leading to remote code execution. Authenticated attackers can exploit this by opening an SSH connection and sending a malicious --split-string env request if the built-in SSH server is activated. Windows installations are unaffected.

##
jbhall56 at 2024-07-11T11:53:03.794Z ##

The vulnerability in question is CVE-2024-4577 (CVSS score: 9.8), which allows an attacker to remotely execute malicious commands on Windows systems using Chinese and Japanese language locales. https://thehackernews.com/2024/07/php-vulnerability-exploited-to-spread.html

##
iagox86 at 2024-07-10T20:47:40.822Z ##

@screaminggoat We've seen an ongoing background hum of exploitation as well, but I'm curious how much is successful.. my recollection is that most stuff isn't vulnerable out of the box

  • https://viz.greynoise.io/tags/php-cve-2024-4577-rce-attempt?days=30
  • https://www.labs.greynoise.io/grimoire/2024-06-13-sup-php-rce-cve-2024-4577/
##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T20:24:43.697Z ##

Akamai: CVE-2024-4577 Exploits in the Wild One Day After Disclosure
Reference: CVE-2024-4577 (9.8 critical, disclosed 06 June 2024 by PHP, added to CISA KEV Catalog 12 June 2024) PHP-CGI OS Command Injection Vulnerability.
As early as one day after disclosure, Akamai Security Intelligence Response Team (SIRT) observed numerous exploit attempts to abuse this vulnerability, indicating high exploitability and quick adoption by threat actors. The exploitations include command injection and multiple malware campaigns: Gh0st RAT, RedTail cryptominers, and XMRig. IOC provided.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_4577 #eitw #activeexploitation #Xmrig #gh0strat #redtail #cryptomining #IOC

##

CVE-2023-51765
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.17%

updated 2024-06-15T09:31:38

2 posts

sendmail through at least 8.14.7 allows SMTP smuggling in certain configurations. Remote attackers can use a published exploitation technique to inject e-mail messages that appear to originate from the sendmail server, allowing bypass of an SPF protection mechanism. This occurs because sendmail supports <LF>.<CR><LF> but some other popular e-mail servers do not.

alanc@fosstodon.org at 2024-07-09T17:37:37.000Z ##

Stacey Marshall, the current sendmail maintainer for #OracleSolaris, has blogged about disabling the CR+LF requirements for SMTP newly enforced in Solaris 11.4.68 and later due to the fix for CVE-2023-51765, for sites stuck with non-compliant SMTP senders:
https://staceymarshall.wordpress.com/2024/07/09/configuring-sendmail-srv_feature/

(Though that should be a short-term solution until you can get the software senders updated to follow the SMTP RFCs.)

##
alanc@fosstodon.org at 2024-07-09T17:37:37.000Z ##

Stacey Marshall, the current sendmail maintainer for #OracleSolaris, has blogged about disabling the CR+LF requirements for SMTP newly enforced in Solaris 11.4.68 and later due to the fix for CVE-2023-51765, for sites stuck with non-compliant SMTP senders:
https://staceymarshall.wordpress.com/2024/07/09/configuring-sendmail-srv_feature/

(Though that should be a short-term solution until you can get the software senders updated to follow the SMTP RFCs.)

##

CVE-2024-30078
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-11T18:30:56

4 posts

Windows Wi-Fi Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

5 repos

https://github.com/nkontopoul/checkwifivulnerability

https://github.com/blkph0x/CVE_2024_30078_POC_WIFI

https://github.com/52by/CVE-2024-30078

https://github.com/kvx07/CVE_2024_30078_A_POC

https://github.com/lvyitian/CVE-2024-30078-

Freyja@eldritch.cafe at 2024-07-17T12:36:27.000Z ##

Si vous n'avez pas mis à jour vos drivers WiFi sous windows depuis un moment, c'est maintenant qu'il faut le faire.

"Un attaquant non authentifié pourrait envoyer un paquet réseau malveillant à un système adjacent qui utilise un adaptateur réseau Wi-Fi, ce qui pourrait permettre l'exécution de code à distance." - Dans ce cas, le code est exécuté sur l'appareil avec les privilèges SYSTEM sur Windows. Ainsi, l'attaquant peut prendre le contrôle de l'appareil.

https://www.it-connect.fr/faille-de-securite-windows-pirater-wifi-cve-2024-30078/

Oui ça date de Juin, mais il y a un exploit qui est en vente en ce moment pour exploiter de la faille.

https://www.tarlogic.com/blog/cve-2024-30078-windows-wi-fi-driver/

#infosec #WiFi #cve_2024_30078

CVE-2024-30103
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-11T18:30:56

2 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

jtig at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.536Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

##
jtig@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.000Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T15:25:30.626Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr

#CVE #eitw #kev #cisa #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_34102 #CVE_2024_28995 #CVE_2022_22948

Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

CVE-2024-27348
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-02T14:50:57

4 posts

RCE-Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server.This issue affects Apache HugeGraph-Server: from 1.0.0 before 1.3.0 in Java8 & Java11 Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.3.0 with Java11 & enable the Auth system, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

##

CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.77%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

6 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T14:58:41.894Z ##

Recorded Future: TAG-100 Uses Open-Source Tools in Suspected Global Espionage Campaign, Compromising Two Asia-Pacific Intergovernmental Bodies
Recorded Future identifies a Russian government-aligned influence network, tracked as TAG-100 targeting global government and private sector organizations. TAG-100 has compromised organizations in at least ten countries across Africa, Asia, North America, South America, and Oceania. TAG-100 exploited internet-facing devices and open-source Go backdoors Pantegana and SparkRAT post-exploitation. The campaign compromised two Asia-Pacific intergovernmental organizations and targeted multiple diplomatic and trade entities. TAG-100 conducted reconnaissance and attempted exploitation of CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS Command Injection Vulnerability) against dozens of US-based organizations. IOC provided. Direct link to 14 page PDF

#threatintel #TAG100 #cyberespionage #russia #CVE_2024_3400 #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-16T14:58:41.000Z ##

Recorded Future: TAG-100 Uses Open-Source Tools in Suspected Global Espionage Campaign, Compromising Two Asia-Pacific Intergovernmental Bodies
Recorded Future identifies a Russian government-aligned influence network, tracked as TAG-100 targeting global government and private sector organizations. TAG-100 has compromised organizations in at least ten countries across Africa, Asia, North America, South America, and Oceania. TAG-100 exploited internet-facing devices and open-source Go backdoors Pantegana and SparkRAT post-exploitation. The campaign compromised two Asia-Pacific intergovernmental organizations and targeted multiple diplomatic and trade entities. TAG-100 conducted reconnaissance and attempted exploitation of CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS Command Injection Vulnerability) against dozens of US-based organizations. IOC provided. Direct link to 14 page PDF

#threatintel #TAG100 #cyberespionage #russia #CVE_2024_3400 #IOC

##
jbhall56 at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.748Z ##

The advisory was released in response to recent attacks that exploited multiple OS command injection security flaws (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, and CVE-2024-21887) to compromise Cisco, Palo Alto, and Ivanti network edge devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-urges-devs-to-weed-out-os-command-injection-vulnerabilities/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.904Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.000Z ##

The advisory was released in response to recent attacks that exploited multiple OS command injection security flaws (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, and CVE-2024-21887) to compromise Cisco, Palo Alto, and Ivanti network edge devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-urges-devs-to-weed-out-os-command-injection-vulnerabilities/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.000Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

jtig at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.536Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

##
jtig@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.000Z ##

CVE-2023-46045
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-30T05:01:49

2 posts

Graphviz 2.36 before 10.0.0 has an out-of-bounds read via a crafted config6a file. NOTE: exploitability may be uncommon because this file is typically owned by root.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T19:59:39.088Z ##

VMware Cloud Foundation security advisory: USN-6708-1: Graphviz vulnerability
CVE-2023-46045 (7.8 high, disclosed 02 February 2024) Graphviz out of bounds read. (Note: VMware thinks it'll cause Denial of Service).
No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2023_46045 #VMware #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

CVE-2023-24068
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-30T05:01:46

2 posts

Signal Desktop before 6.2.0 on Windows, Linux, and macOS allows an attacker to modify conversation attachments within the attachments.noindex directory. Client mechanisms fail to validate modifications of existing cached files, resulting in an attacker's ability to insert malicious code into pre-existing attachments or replace them completely. A threat actor can forward the existing attachment in

https://johnjhacking.com/blog/cve-2023-24068-cve-2023-24069/

##

CVE-2024-27198
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.16%

updated 2024-03-21T05:01:12

4 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 authentication bypass allowing to perform admin actions was possible

Nuclei template

9 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2024-27198-EXPLOIT

https://github.com/Shimon03/Explora-o-RCE-n-o-autenticado-JetBrains-TeamCity-CVE-2024-27198-

https://github.com/passwa11/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/rampantspark/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/Stuub/RCity-CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/CharonDefalt/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T23:59:49.135Z ##

@vitriolix @campuscodi

Starting with JetBrains' security advisory on 04 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/ JetBrains was forced to publicly warn their customers that Rapid7 was going to imminently release Proofs of Concepts for the critical authentication bypass vulnerability.

The Rapid7's blog, released within an hour of JetBrains' advisory, does just that. The timeline tells you everything you need to know about how it went down: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

JetBrains, upset about the bad optics, releases "their side of the story" the next day: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/ In this blog, they readily admit to breaking protocol and refusing to do a coordinated vulnerability disclosure:

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

JetBrains, with their TeamCity customers under mass exploitation, doubles down and all but blames Rapid7 for releasing the PoCs in another blog post on 11 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/ They continue to insist on silent patching.

Since then, JetBrains has never published a security advisory in a blog post. You have to manually visit their Fixed security issues page to find CVE IDs. No other vendor takes over a week to identify the vulnerabilities and CVE IDs. If JetBrains didn't want the bad reputation, perhaps they should have written better code in the first place. Bug hunters who responsibly report these vulnerabilities are not the enemy here.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T15:40:17.783Z ##

JetBrains: TeamCity 2024.07 Is Here
I hate JetBrains but enough of you use TeamCity to report on this. TeamCity has a new version 2024.07 which came out today. Buried deep in their release notes is the only indication that any vulnerabilities were patched.

19 security problems have been fixed.

At this time of this toot, JetBrains' own Fixed security issues page is missing the 2024.07 dropdown option so they don't even identify any CVE IDs. A search for TeamCity on cve.mitre.org doesn't show any new CVEs since 01 July 2024.

Ever since JetBrains' feud with Rapid7 in March 2024, they are convinced that silent patching is the appropriate way to handle vulnerabilities. Now your customers don't even know why they should upgrade their TeamCity, or what n-day vulnerability they're being exploited with.

Patch your TeamCity. TeamCity vulnerabilities are known to be exploited by ransomware groups. cc: @campuscodi

#jetbrains #teamcity #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-18T23:59:49.000Z ##

Bug hunters who responsibly report these vulnerabilities are not the enemy here.

JetBrains, upset about the bad optics, releases "their side of the story" the next day: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/ In this blog, they readily admit to breaking protocol and refusing to do a coordinated vulnerability disclosure:

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

JetBrains, with their TeamCity customers under mass exploitation, doubles down and all but blames Rapid7 for releasing the PoCs in another blog post on 11 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/ They continue to insist on silent patching.

Since then, JetBrains has never published a security advisory in a blog post. You have to manually visit their Fixed security issues page to find CVE IDs. No other vendor takes over a week to identify the vulnerabilities and CVE IDs. If JetBrains didn't want the bad reputation, perhaps they should have written better code in the first place. Bug hunters who responsibly report these vulnerabilities are not the enemy here.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-18T15:40:17.000Z ##

JetBrains: TeamCity 2024.07 Is Here
I hate JetBrains but enough of you use TeamCity to report on this. TeamCity has a new version 2024.07 which came out today. Buried deep in their release notes is the only indication that any vulnerabilities were patched.

19 security problems have been fixed.

At this time of this toot, JetBrains' own Fixed security issues page is missing the 2024.07 dropdown option so they don't even identify any CVE IDs. A search for TeamCity on cve.mitre.org doesn't show any new CVEs since 01 July 2024.

Ever since JetBrains' feud with Rapid7 in March 2024, they are convinced that silent patching is the appropriate way to handle vulnerabilities. Now your customers don't even know why they should upgrade their TeamCity, or what n-day vulnerability they're being exploited with.

Patch your TeamCity. TeamCity vulnerabilities are known to be exploited by ransomware groups. cc: @campuscodi

#jetbrains #teamcity #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2008-0166
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 8.17%

updated 2024-02-18T05:07:33

4 posts

OpenSSL 0.9.8c-1 up to versions before 0.9.8g-9 on Debian-based operating systems uses a random number generator that generates predictable numbers, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct brute force guessing attacks against cryptographic keys.

4 repos

https://github.com/avarx/vulnkeys

https://github.com/demining/Vulnerable-to-Debian-OpenSSL-bug-CVE-2008-0166

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl

https://github.com/g0tmi1k/debian-ssh

kurtseifried at 2024-07-19T23:22:21.171Z ##

@postmodern Yup, posting here again:

Here's the thing:

The worst, most impactful Open Source security issue was...

log4j? Hardly any outages, the only big one I know of was Canada Revenue Agency (Canadian IRS basically) shutdown their website for a week right before tax deadline, and granted an extensions. But this is their well known emergency plan for dealking with critical software vulns that could result in their system getting hacked (e.g. previous incidents like HEARTBLEED: https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/heartbleed-bug-cyberattack-canada-government-departments-1.3355993)

SPECTRE and MELTDOWN perhaps? Some buggy updates were released that could brick systems (https://www.securityweek.com/hp-dell-halt-bios-updates-over-buggy-cpu-patches/) but obviously nothing on the scale of this CrowdStrike issue.

Debian's OpenSSL "oopsie" back in 2008 https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2008-0166 but I'll be darned if I ever found real reports of exploitation having an actual impact.

I feel like if we took EVERY major open source incident, balled them together, we still wouldn't have 1% of the disruption that Crowdstrike caused.

I would challenge anyone to find open source security bugs that had a major impact and reply here, hint: they're hard to find because most of them had very, very minimal public facing impacts.

jbhall56 at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.748Z ##

The advisory was released in response to recent attacks that exploited multiple OS command injection security flaws (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, and CVE-2024-21887) to compromise Cisco, Palo Alto, and Ivanti network edge devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-urges-devs-to-weed-out-os-command-injection-vulnerabilities/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.904Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.000Z ##

The advisory was released in response to recent attacks that exploited multiple OS command injection security flaws (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, and CVE-2024-21887) to compromise Cisco, Palo Alto, and Ivanti network edge devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-urges-devs-to-weed-out-os-command-injection-vulnerabilities/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-10T17:44:38.000Z ##

CISA: Secure by Design Alert: Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities
CISA and FBI are releasing their newest Secure by Design Alert in the series, Eliminating OS Command Injection Vulnerabilities, in response to recent well-publicized threat actor campaigns that exploited OS command injection defects in network edge devices (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, CVE-2024-21887) to target and compromise users. These vulnerabilities allowed unauthenticated malicious actors to remotely execute code on network edge devices.
OS command injection vulnerabilities have long been preventable by clearly separating user input from the contents of a command. Despite this finding, OS command injection vulnerabilities—many of which result from CWE-78—are still a prevalent class of vulnerability. 4 page PDF

#CISA #securebydesign

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T14:47:25.315Z ##

Sygnia: The Return of Ghost Emperor's Demodex
A Chinese threat actor has been linked to a late 2023 attack that pivoted to the network of the victim's business partner. A variant of the Demodex rootkit was identified, associated with GhostEmperor. They are known to mainly target Southeast Asian telecommunications and government entities. While Sygnia mentions #ProxyLogon (CVE-2021-26855) as a previous initial access method, it does not elaborate and describes GhostEmperor's infection chain as using a batch file. Sygnia provides a technical analysis of the infection chain, and lists IOC.

h/t @therecord_media for the related reporting: ‘GhostEmperor’ returns: Mysterious Chinese hacking group spotted for first time in two years

#threatintel #ghostemperor #china #cyberespionage #IOC #CVE_2021_26855

##

A Chinese threat actor has been linked to a late 2023 attack that pivoted to the network of the victim's business partner. In case you overlooked the Citrix security advisory that I tooted, Netscaler has a 9.4 (critical severity) sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-6235.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-6235: A similar Citrix Netscaler information disclosure vulnerability CVE-2023-4966 #CitrixBleed was massively exploited even by ransomware groups.

https://github.com/tiepologian/CVE-2023-23397

https://github.com/SecCTechs/CVE-2023-23397

https://github.com/Cyb3rMaddy/CVE-2023-23397-Report

jtig at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.536Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

##

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T17:23:48.901Z ##

Group-IB: Patch or Peril: A Veeam vulnerability incident
EstateRansomware (one word) is a new ransomware group that's exploiting CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high, disclosed 07 March 2023 by Veeam) Veeam Backup & Replication Cloud Connect Missing Authentication for Critical Function Vulnerability. The blog provides an overview of the attacker’s tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), from initial access via FortiGate SSL VPN to the impact of the ransomware. IOC provided.

##

CVE-2020-5408
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:03

2 posts

Spring Security versions 5.3.x prior to 5.3.2, 5.2.x prior to 5.2.4, 5.1.x prior to 5.1.10, 5.0.x prior to 5.0.16 and 4.2.x prior to 4.2.16 use a fixed null initialization vector with CBC Mode in the implementation of the queryable text encryptor. A malicious user with access to the data that has been encrypted using such an encryptor may be able to derive the unencrypted values using a dictionary

neilmadden at 2024-07-17T17:26:46.503Z ##

@JPatONeil Almost every line of code in that package does something wrong from a crypto perspective:

  • they have unauthenticated CBC mode encryption as the “standard” option, which also silently uses a fixed zero IV so is completely insecure
  • one of the GCM implementations uses BouncyCastle’s “fast” table-lookup AES implementations, which likely has side-channels galore
  • the RSA encryption defaults to 1024-bit keys, which are not remotely secure by modern standards
  • it also defaults to PKCS#1 v1.5 padding, which is also not secure
  • the “raw” RSA implementation actually runs RSA in ECB mode if the message is longer than the modulus allows (quite likely given they use small keys). This is absolutely terrible.
  • the “secret” RSA encryption, which attempts to do hybrid encryption (with GCM), generates a random per-message AES key (good) but then treats it as a password and sends it through 1024 rounds of PBKDF2, so is incredibly slow. (It then pointlessly uses AES-256-GCM despite only generating a 128-bit key, again adding overhead for no security reason).

I’m sure there’s more that can be found by a more thorough review, that’s just the stuff that screams at me from 10 minutes looking at it. (And I’m pretty sure they only have GCM at all because I told them to add it years ago, as part of CVE-2020-5408).

Nobody with any crypto knowledge has been involved in developing that library, so why is it in a flagship framework?

##
neilmadden@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-17T17:26:46.000Z ##

@JPatONeil Almost every line of code in that package does something wrong from a crypto perspective:

  • they have unauthenticated CBC mode encryption as the “standard” option, which also silently uses a fixed zero IV so is completely insecure
  • one of the GCM implementations uses BouncyCastle’s “fast” table-lookup AES implementations, which likely has side-channels galore
  • the RSA encryption defaults to 1024-bit keys, which are not remotely secure by modern standards
  • it also defaults to PKCS#1 v1.5 padding, which is also not secure
  • the “raw” RSA implementation actually runs RSA in ECB mode if the message is longer than the modulus allows (quite likely given they use small keys). This is absolutely terrible.
  • the “secret” RSA encryption, which attempts to do hybrid encryption (with GCM), generates a random per-message AES key (good) but then treats it as a password and sends it through 1024 rounds of PBKDF2, so is incredibly slow. (It then pointlessly uses AES-256-GCM despite only generating a 128-bit key, again adding overhead for no security reason).

I’m sure there’s more that can be found by a more thorough review, that’s just the stuff that screams at me from 10 minutes looking at it. (And I’m pretty sure they only have GCM at all because I told them to add it years ago, as part of CVE-2020-5408).

Nobody with any crypto knowledge has been involved in developing that library, so why is it in a flagship framework?

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T15:25:30.626Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr

CVE-2021-3129
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.47%

updated 2022-02-22T10:15:18.317000

12 posts

Ignition before 2.5.2, as used in Laravel and other products, allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary code because of insecure usage of file_get_contents() and file_put_contents(). This is exploitable on sites using debug mode with Laravel before 8.4.2.

##

CVE-2019-18394
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 60.69%

updated 2020-08-07T01:15:10.843000

12 posts

A Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in FaviconServlet.java in Ignite Realtime Openfire through 4.4.2 allows attackers to send arbitrary HTTP GET requests.

Nuclei template

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-07-16T06:15:01.000Z ##

🔮 CRYSTALRAY hacker expands to 1,500 breached systems using SSH-Snake tool
ᐅ @BleepingComputer

"CRYSTALRAY's motivations are to collect and sell credentials, deploy cryptominers, and maintain persistence in victim environments. Some of the OSS tools the threat actor is leveraging include zmap, asn, httpx, nuclei, platypus, and SSH-Snake."

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/crystalray-hacker-expands-to-1-500-breached-systems-using-ssh-snake-tool/

#Worm #SSHSnake #CVE201918394 #CVE202244877 #CVE20213129 #CVE #Infosec

CVE-2024-6509
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T14:29:28.529Z ##

Trend Micro: The Potential Impact of the OpenSSH Vulnerabilities CVE-2024–6387 and CVE-2024-6409
I'm sure this dead horse has been beaten thoroughly but just in case: Trend Micro checks the OpenSSH vulnerabilities CVE-2024-6387 and CVE-2024-6409, examining their potential real-world impact and the possibility of exploitation for CVE-2024–6387 in x64 systems.

Check parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-6387 #regreSSHion.
CVE-2024-6409 (7.0 high, disclosed 08 July 2024 by OpenWall) is another OpenSSH race condition vulnerability allowing for RCE as well.

#openssh #vulnerability #CVE_2024_6387 #CVE_2024_6509

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T19:23:02.043Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
CVE-2024-37381 (8.4 high) SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2024 flat to arbitrary code execution

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

#CVE_2024_37381 #Ivanti #vulnerability #CVE

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
CVE-2024-37381 (8.4 high) SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2024 flat to arbitrary code execution

#CVE_2024_37381 #Ivanti #vulnerability #CVE

##
nydus@social.tchncs.de at 2024-07-19T14:01:41.000Z ##

Sicherheitslücke im Ivanti Endpoint Manager behoben: Ivanti warnt vor Schwachstelle im Endpoint Manager (EPM). Aktuell sind keine Angriffe bekannt. Dennoch sollten Admins ihre Systeme dringend absichern. Admins nutzen EPM zur Endgeräteverwaltung. Entwickler berichten in einem Beitrag, dass die Lücke (CVE-2024-37381 "hoch") in EPM 2024 flat besteht. Ob andere Versionen betroffen sind, bleibt unklar. Für künftige EPM-Versionen wird das Sicherheitsproblem behoben. https://nydus.org/news/131936-sicherheitslucke-im-ivanti-endpoint-manager-behoben.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T16:37:52.061Z ##

Ivanti security advisories! Blog: July Security Update

  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM): Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
    • CVE-2024-37381 (8.4) SQL Injection vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM): Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM) July 2024
    • CVE-2024-36130 (8.8 high) insufficient authorization vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36131 (8.8 high) insecure deserialization > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36132 (8.2 high) insufficient authentication verification > auth bypass and sensitive info disclosure
    • CVE-2024-34788 (5.3 medium) improper authentication > sensitive info disclosure
  • Ivanti Docs@Work for Android: Security Advisory CVE-2024-37403 (Dirty Stream) for Ivanti Docs@Work for Android
    • CVE-2024-37403 (5.0 medium) aka #DirtyStream path traversal (cc: @cR0w @reverseics) > sensitive info disclosure

We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild.

#Ivanti #CVE #epm #epmm #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-17T16:37:52.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisories! Blog: July Security Update

  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM): Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
    • CVE-2024-37381 (8.4) SQL Injection vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM): Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM) July 2024
    • CVE-2024-36130 (8.8 high) insufficient authorization vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36131 (8.8 high) insecure deserialization > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36132 (8.2 high) insufficient authentication verification > auth bypass and sensitive info disclosure
    • CVE-2024-34788 (5.3 medium) improper authentication > sensitive info disclosure
  • Ivanti Docs@Work for Android: Security Advisory CVE-2024-37403 (Dirty Stream) for Ivanti Docs@Work for Android
    • CVE-2024-37403 (5.0 medium) aka #DirtyStream path traversal (cc: @cR0w @reverseics) > sensitive info disclosure

We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild.

#Ivanti #CVE #epm #epmm #vulnerability

Todays gem: "We have this obscure network setup with 30000 requests per second and after the upgrade to RHEL8 we see a 0.005% error rate" - "Oh yeah, that's probably a side effect of the fix for CVE-2022-1012"

marcellinusme@mastodon.social at 2024-07-19T09:33:28.000Z ##

@harld Was dat niet de kwetsbaarheid van het logfile van de Apache webserver? Of was het #DirtyPipe CVE-2022-0847 met de mogelijkheid een SSH key aan te maken en een Linux-server over te nemen?
In ieder geval zijn beide kwetsbaarheden na ontdekking snel opgelost door de open source community. Het was ook geen wereldwijde onberekenbare schade.

##
marcellinusme@mastodon.social at 2024-07-19T09:33:28.000Z ##

@harld Was dat niet de kwetsbaarheid van het logfile van de Apache webserver? Of was het #DirtyPipe CVE-2022-0847 met de mogelijkheid een SSH key aan te maken en een Linux-server over te nemen?
In ieder geval zijn beide kwetsbaarheden na ontdekking snel opgelost door de open source community. Het was ook geen wereldwijde onberekenbare schade.

    • CVE-2024-37381 (8.4) SQL Injection vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM): Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM) July 2024
    • CVE-2024-36130 (8.8 high) insufficient authorization vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36131 (8.8 high) insecure deserialization > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36132 (8.2 high) insufficient authentication verification > auth bypass and sensitive info disclosure
    • CVE-2024-34788 (5.3 medium) improper authentication > sensitive info disclosure
  • Ivanti Docs@Work for Android: Security Advisory CVE-2024-37403 (Dirty Stream) for Ivanti Docs@Work for Android
    • CVE-2024-37403 (5.0 medium) aka #DirtyStream path traversal (cc: @cR0w @reverseics) > sensitive info disclosure

We have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild.

#Ivanti #CVE #epm #epmm #vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-17T16:37:52.000Z ##

  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM): Security Advisory EPM July 2024 for EPM 2024
    • CVE-2024-37381 (8.4) SQL Injection vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM): Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager for Mobile (EPMM) July 2024
    • CVE-2024-36130 (8.8 high) insufficient authorization vulnerability > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36131 (8.8 high) insecure deserialization > arbitrary code execution
    • CVE-2024-36132 (8.2 high) insufficient authentication verification > auth bypass and sensitive info disclosure

##

CVE-2024-38510
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

1 posts

N/A

nydus@social.tchncs.de at 2024-07-16T13:07:17.000Z ##

Sicherheitslücken bei Lenovo: Bedrohung für Server und Appliances: Lenovo hat kürzlich schwere Schwachstellen in ihrem Management-Controller XClarity (XCC) entdeckt. Diese gefährden mehrere Appliances und Servermodelle erheblich. Schadcode könnte unerlaubt auf die Systeme gelangen. In einer offiziellen Warnmeldung hat Lenovo den Schweregrad der Sicherheitslücken (CVE-2024-38508, CVE-2024-38509, CVE-2024-38510, CVE-2024-38511, CVE-2024-38512) als "hoch" eingestuft. https://nydus.org/news/131925-sicherheitslucken-bei-lenovo-bedrohung-fur-server-und-appliances.html

##

CVE-2024-37903

vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-11T14:23:33.000Z ##

1 week later, and 72.8% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 92.9% of Mastodon users.

Since I'll be traveling for the next few days, and changes will likely be less than 1% from day to day, I will likely not update again until next week.

#MastoAdmin #CVE202437903

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-10T13:48:08.000Z ##

6 days later, and and 71.9% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 92.7% of Mastodon users.

Two large instances patched yesterday.

#mastoadmin #CVE202437903

#mastoadmin #CVE202437903

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-07-08T07:52:35.000Z ##

Ah, yes. So the security issue that caused the surprise update to #Mastodon 4.2.10 on the 4th of July has a name: CVE-2024-37903 Improper authorship check on audience extension for existing posts

More details will be published on the 15th of July.
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-xjvf-fm67-4qc3

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-07T15:16:32.000Z ##

72 hours later, and 64.9% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 86.4% of Mastodon users.

For some reason, 12 of the top 100 instances (6 of the top 25) by active users have yet to patch. Once this happens total user coverage should jump significantly.

The long tail is always instances that have less than ten users. They make up 71% of instances but only represent 0.27% of total users.

#mastoadmin #CVE202437903

##

CVE-2024-37985
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T12:24:09.349Z ##

@shellsharks According to The Hacker News, CVE-2024-37985 (5.9 medium, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft) "Arm: CVE-2024-37985 Systematic Identification and Characterization of Proprietary Prefetchers" is a a side-channel attack called FetchBench.

Here is a non paywall 15 page PDF: https://publications.cispa.saarland/3991/1/ccs23-fetchbench.pdf

#FetchBench #CVE_2024_37985 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-07-10T04:43:23.137Z ##

Microsoft Patch Tuesday July 2024

(Pic 1) List of KBs released corresponding to each OS

(Pic 2) List of Zero-days released(2 of them exploited in-the-wild already)

**Patch CVE-2024-38080 and CVE-2024-38112 NOW !!

CVE-2024-38080(Zero-day Exploited-in-the-wild): https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38080

CVE-2024-38112(Zero-day Exploited-in-the-wild): https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38112

CVE-2024-35264: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-35264

CVE-2024-37985: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-37985

List of Vulnerabilities addressed in Patch Tuesday July 2024:

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-us/releaseNote/2024-Jul

screaminggoat at 2024-07-09T17:09:01.308Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 142 vulnerabilities, FOUR zero days

  • CVE-2024-38112 (7.5 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability (EXPLOITED ONLY)
  • CVE-2024-38080 (7.8 high) Windows Hyper-V Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED ONLY)
  • CVE-2024-37985 (5.9 medium) Arm: CVE-2024-37985 Systematic Identification and Characterization of Proprietary Prefetchers (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED ONLY)
  • CVE-2024-35264 (8.1 high) .NET and Visual Studio Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED ONLY)

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @cR0w @regnil @bschwifty @arinc629 @Cali @wvu @hrbrmstr @avoidthehack @bieberium @TheDustinChilds (make sure to remove all the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

screaminggoat at 2024-07-09T16:00:59.897Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-23-485 CVE-2024-26006 (7.5 high) Cross site scripting vulnerability in SSL VPN web UI
  • FG-IR-24-073 CVE-2024-27785 (5.4 medium) FortiAIOps - CSV Injection in export device inventory feature
  • FG-IR-24-070 CVE-2024-27783 (7.6 high) FortiAIOps - Cross-site request forgery
  • FG-IR-24-069 CVE-2024-27782 (8.1 high) FortiAIOps - Improper Session Management
  • FG-IR-24-072 CVE-2024-27784 (8.8 high) FortiAIOps - Sensitive Information leak to an Unauthorized Actor
  • FG-IR-23-446 CVE-2024-26015 (3.4 low) FortiOS - IP address validation mishandles zero characters
  • FG-IR-23-469 CVE-2023-50181 (4.9 medium) Improper access control vulnerability in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-011 CVE-2024-21759 (4.3 medium) Insecure Direct Object Reference in policy API Endpoint
  • FG-IR-22-298 CVE-2023-50178 (7.4 high) Multiple lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections
  • FG-IR-24-258 CVE-2024-6387 (8.1 high) OpenSSH #regreSSHion Attack (CVE-2024-6387)
  • FG-IR-23-459 CVE-2024-23663 (8.8 high) Privilege escalation from low privilege administrator
  • FG-IR-23-480 CVE-2023-50179 (4.8 medium) [FortiADC] Lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections with public SDN connectors
  • FG-IR-22-326 CVE-2024-33509 (4.8 medium) [FortiWeb] Lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections

No mention of exploitation.

#Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-09T16:00:59.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-23-485 CVE-2024-26006 (7.5 high) Cross site scripting vulnerability in SSL VPN web UI
  • FG-IR-24-073 CVE-2024-27785 (5.4 medium) FortiAIOps - CSV Injection in export device inventory feature
  • FG-IR-24-070 CVE-2024-27783 (7.6 high) FortiAIOps - Cross-site request forgery
  • FG-IR-24-069 CVE-2024-27782 (8.1 high) FortiAIOps - Improper Session Management
  • FG-IR-24-072 CVE-2024-27784 (8.8 high) FortiAIOps - Sensitive Information leak to an Unauthorized Actor
  • FG-IR-23-446 CVE-2024-26015 (3.4 low) FortiOS - IP address validation mishandles zero characters
  • FG-IR-23-469 CVE-2023-50181 (4.9 medium) Improper access control vulnerability in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-011 CVE-2024-21759 (4.3 medium) Insecure Direct Object Reference in policy API Endpoint
  • FG-IR-22-298 CVE-2023-50178 (7.4 high) Multiple lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections
  • FG-IR-24-258 CVE-2024-6387 (8.1 high) OpenSSH #regreSSHion Attack (CVE-2024-6387)
  • FG-IR-23-459 CVE-2024-23663 (8.8 high) Privilege escalation from low privilege administrator
  • FG-IR-23-480 CVE-2023-50179 (4.8 medium) [FortiADC] Lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections with public SDN connectors
  • FG-IR-22-326 CVE-2024-33509 (4.8 medium) [FortiWeb] Lack of client-side certificate validation when establishing secure connections

No mention of exploitation.
